summary: This is an email chain from July 30, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's medical care at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It addresses allegations from Epstein's attorneys that he was not receiving cholesterol or back pain medication, with a pharmacist confirming an active prescription for Vascepa but no prescription for back pain on file.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center whose attorneys have alleged he is not receiving cholesterol or back pain medication.

events.title: Vascepa medication dispensed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's prescription for Vascepa (a cholesterol medication) was dispensed for a 30-day supply.

events.title: Email regarding medical care allegations
events.description: An email chain discusses allegations from Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys that he was not receiving prescribed cholesterol or back pain medication while incarcerated.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 30, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys had alleged he was not receiving his cholesterol medication (Vascepa) or back pain medication while incarcerated.
A pharmacist confirmed an active, refillable prescription for Vascepa was dispensed on July 17, 2019, but noted no prescription for back pain was on file.
The correspondence shows internal communication about inmate medical care at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The document is marked as containing potentially SENSITIVE information and is intended for official use only.
